title: Gunman opens fire outside Manchester takeaway
text:
A gunman opened fire outside a Manchester takeaway during yesterday's rush hour, leaving a wounded man 'screaming in pain'.

A worker at the Canadian Charcoal takeaway on Stockport Road in Levenshulme described hearing gunshots 'like fireworks' around 5.15pm before seeing the victim lying on the ground.

He was taken to hospital by ambulance and his injuries are not thought to be life threatening, according to police.

A worker at the Canadian Charcoal takeaway on Stockport Road in Levenshulme described hearing gunshots 'like fireworks' around 5.15pm before seeing the victim lying on the ground. Pictured are police searching nearby yesterday

Takeaway worker Awat said: 'I heard what I thought was fireworks. When I came back, a guy was on the floor.

'Many people were around him. He was shouting in pain, he was screaming. He was tensing his arms in pain.

'He was between 22 and 25. Eight or nine people were around him. After a few minutes police and ambulance came. They took him away.

'That's the first time something like this has happened.'

Officers from Greater Manchester Police set up a 200-yard cordon around the usually busy A-road and are combing the area for evidence.

GMP said: 'At around 5.15pm on Monday, October 7, police were called to Stockport Road in Levenshulme to reports that a man had been shot.

'The man has been taken to hospital for treatment; however his injuries are not believed to be life-threatening at this time.

'Police are currently in attendance and enquiries are ongoing.'
description: A worker at the Canadian Charcoal takeaway on Stockport Road in Levenshulme described hearing gunshots 'like fireworks' around 5.15pm before seeing the victim lying on the ground.
